text: Hi Felicia, apologies I hadn't check in because I thought I'd get an email alert when your replied. I assumed you were still busy with the move. So basically I only started in VFX a 2 and a half years ago and began by doing a nuke roto internship for 6 months on game of thrones.  After that I began working at jam on a mixed media Kids TV show called Becca's bunch. It was a combination of puppets and CG but a lot of the work I did on it was roto, basic clean up and very basic compositing of just placing the characters in position. All of that work was on after effects. I then spent the next 6 months on a new show keying its main live action character. Now I've I'm on the compositing team but its been a bit of a baptism of fire. Like your experience the small nature of the company has allowed me to move onto new positions but I know there's plenty of room for improvement on my skillset and want to train very hard over the next year to bring them up to par. I also want to piece a good show reel together because even though the end result of the shows we are working on look good, its still kids TV and I don't want that to be the only thing on my show reel. The only thing I feel I have a pretty good grasp of is keying. I even want to go back an work on making my roto more efficient. I was thinking clean up was a decent place to start too. Do you have any resources that or bits off footage to work on that you found particularly helpful when you were learning.
Apologies again for the delay in reply.  Ill be sure to check in more regularly in future.
